questions.article:
The following text is adapted from Rudolfo Anaya's 1972 novel Bless Me, Ultima. The young narrator is eating breakfast with his two sisters in their home in rural New Mexico.

I sat across the table from Deborah and Teresa and ate my atole and the hot tortilla with butter. I said very little. I usually spoke very little to my two sisters. They were older than I and they were very close. They usually spent the entire day in the attic, playing dolls and giggling. I did not concern myself with those things.
questions.question: As used in the text, what does the phrase “concern myself with" most nearly mean?

options.name: A
options.content: Craft

options.name: B
options.content: Get angry about

options.name: C
options.content: Care about

options.name: D
options.content: Earn

questions.correct: Care about

questions.article: The percentage of US forest land that a 2023 federal report identified as being either mature or old growth exceeds other recent estimates. Given how little ______ there is among scientists regarding the scope of these categories, this discrepancy shouldn't be surprising: forest researchers regularly dispute one another's classifications.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: interest

options.name: B
options.content: deliberation

options.name: C
options.content: vigilance

options.name: D
options.content: consensus

questions.correct: consensus

questions.article: Karam Kang has demonstrated that lobbying does little to alter the probability that a particular energy policy under consideration by the United States Congress will be enacted, but lobbying is not as ________ as this finding seems to suggest. As Kang herself notes, lobbying can shape which policy proposals members of Congress bring forward for consideration in the first place.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: counterproductive

options.name: B
options.content: cynical

options.name: C
options.content: biased

options.name: D
options.content: ineffectual

questions.correct: ineffectual

questions.article: Though it does not guarantee a book's commercial success, ______ can play a big role in that success—a well-executed marketing campaign helped to make Danielle Steel's novel The Gift the fourth-best-selling novel of 1994.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: originality

options.name: B
options.content: publicity

options.name: C
options.content: complexity

options.name: D
options.content: practicality

questions.correct: publicity

questions.article: People sometimes dismiss a claim if it comes from a source they regard as self-interested, but from a strictly logical perspective, the source of a claim is ________: it has no direct bearing on whether the claim is true.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical and precise word or phrase?

options.name: A
options.content: implicit

options.name: B
options.content: indisputable

options.name: C
options.content: indistinct

options.name: D
options.content: irrelevant

questions.correct: irrelevant

questions.article: When people think of dinosaurs with feathers, they typically think of winged dinosaurs, such as the four-winged Microraptor. However, many dinosaurs that didn't have wings also had feathers on their bodies. For instance, research indicates that the wingless, speedy Ornithomimus likely had feathers.
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined sentence in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It reveals that the dinosaurs mentioned earlier in the text used their feathers for an important purpose.

options.name: B
options.content: It gives an example of a dinosaur with the characteristics mentioned earlier in the text.

options.name: C
options.content: It defines a term related to the type of dinosaur feathers mentioned earlier in the text.

options.name: D
options.content: It indicates that the dinosaurs mentioned earlier in the text weren't the only ones that had feathers.

questions.correct: It indicates that the dinosaurs mentioned earlier in the text weren't the only ones that had feathers.

questions.article:
The following text is from Annie Dillard's 1987 autobiographical novel An American Childhood. The narrator is a young girl living in Pittsburgh.

I walked. My mother had given me the freedom of the streets as soon as I could say our telephone number. I walked and memorized the neighborhood. I made a mental map and located myself upon it. At night in bed I rehearsed the small world's scheme and set challenges: Find the store using backyards only. Imagine a route from the school to my friend's house.

©1987 by Annie Dillard
questions.question: Which choice best describes the function of the underlined portion in the text as a whole?

options.name: A
options.content: It describes the narrator trying to memorize her telephone number.

options.name: B
options.content: It provides examples of what the narrator thinks about at night.

options.name: C
options.content: It gives directions to the narrator's favorite local store.

options.name: D
options.content: It portrays the narrator's relationship with her mother.

questions.correct: It provides examples of what the narrator thinks about at night.

questions.article: Gus Edwards's atmospheric play Black Body Blues was produced in 1978 by the groundbreaking Negro Ensemble Company (NEC). NEC cofounder Douglas Turner Ward, who worked as an actor, director, and playwright, had met actor and producer Robert Hooks while they were performing in a 1960 touring production of Lorraine Hansberry's play A Raisin in the Sun. Together, they envisioned a theater company that would nurture and showcase the work of Black theater professionals. Since NEC's founding in 1967, its workshops and performances have given Black playwrights, including Edwards, a forum for their compelling stories.
questions.question: Which choice best states the main purpose of the text?

options.name: A
options.content: To show how the play A Raisin in the Sun influenced Ward and Hooks.

options.name: B
options.content: To bring attention to a work by Gus Edwards.

options.name: C
options.content: To describe how Ward and Hooks's creative partnership changed over time.

options.name: D
options.content: To discuss the origin and importance of the NEC.

questions.correct: To discuss the origin and importance of the NEC.

questions.article: The food industry has long used thermal technologies to preserve food in large batches. Recent advancements in infrared heating were made through research in Mexico on the preservation of bean flour. Infrared heating is generally considered to be an improvement over more conventional thermal preservation methods: whereas conventional methods transfer energy from the surface of a food to its interior, infrared heating uses high-intensity infrared light to generate heat within the food itself, thus reducing industrial cooking times.
questions.question: Based on the text, what is one disadvantage of some conventional thermal preservation methods?

options.name: A
options.content: They are especially vulnerable to technological breakdowns.

options.name: B
options.content: They are only effective in heating foods that are lightweight and small in size.

options.name: C
options.content: Their cooking times are longer than those of other methods.

options.name: D
options.content: They require more energy than other methods do.

questions.correct: Their cooking times are longer than those of other methods.

questions.article: “Cocoa” is an example of a loanword—that is, a word that originated in one language and was later adopted by another. The word came to English indirectly from cacao, the Spanish word for the plant that chocolate is made from. Spanish had borrowed it from Nahuatl, an Indigenous language of Central Mexico, in which the word's original form is cacahuatl. “Iguana” is also Indigenous in origin and entered English through Spanish. But in this case, the original source was Taino, a language of the Caribbean islands, in which the word for the group of related lizard species is iwana.
questions.question: The author makes which point about the Spanish language?

options.name: A
options.content: It has served as a medium through which Indigenous languages have influenced English.

options.name: B
options.content: Its contribution to English vocabulary roughly equals the collective contribution by Indigenous languages.

options.name: C
options.content: It has borrowed words from Indigenous languages and contributed words to them.

options.name: D
options.content: It adopted Nahuatl and Taino words in approximately equal numbers.

questions.correct: It has served as a medium through which Indigenous languages have influenced English.

questions.article:
Total Areas of Five Tribal Nations around the United States

In terms of total area, the Navajo Nation is the largest tribal nation in the United States. It covers 24,425 square miles in Arizona, Colorado, and New Mexico. Most tribal nations in the US are much smaller. For example, the total area of the Muscogee Nation in Oklahoma is 4,867 square miles. And in Washington, the total area of the Colville Tribes is ________
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the statement?

options.name: A
options.content: 2,185 square miles.

options.name: B
options.content: 707 square miles.

options.name: C
options.content: 6,963 square miles.

options.name: D
options.content: 1,583 square miles.

questions.correct: 2,185 square miles.

questions.article:
Millions of Metric Tons of Copper Mined in 1995 and 2020

While doing research for a paper about copper mining, a student finds a table with information about four different countries. The student notes that the country that mined 0.55 million metric tons of copper in 2020 had mined _______
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the statement?

options.name: A
options.content: 0.26 million metric tons of copper in 1995.

options.name: B
options.content: 0.59 million metric tons of copper in 1995.

options.name: C
options.content: 2.49 million metric tons of copper in 1995.

options.name: D
options.content: 0.38 million metric tons of copper in 1995.

questions.correct: 0.26 million metric tons of copper in 1995.

questions.article: “A Pair of Silk Stockings” is an 1897 short story written by Kate Chopin. In the story, Chopin suggests that the protagonist, Mrs. Sommers, experiences a shift in her sense of self as a result of putting on certain articles of clothing, writing, ______
questions.question: Which quotation from “A Pair of Silk Stockings” most effectively illustrates the claim?

options.name: A
options.content: “Mrs. Sommers was one who knew the value of bargains; who could stand for hours making her way inch by inch toward the desired object that was selling below cost.”

options.name: B
options.content: “She held back her skirts and turned her feet one way and her head another way as she glanced down at the polished, pointed-tipped boots.”

options.name: C
options.content: “She would buy so and so many yards of percale for new shirt waists for the boys and Janie and Mag.”

options.name: D
options.content: “Her stockings and boots and well fitting gloves had worked marvels in her bearing—had given her a feeling of assurance, a sense of belonging to the well-dressed multitude.”

questions.correct: “Her stockings and boots and well fitting gloves had worked marvels in her bearing—had given her a feeling of assurance, a sense of belonging to the well-dressed multitude.”

questions.article:
Average Hours Worked per Person per Year in 1950 and 2017

Calculations may be inexact due to rounding

A student in an economics course is examining the decline since 1950 in average hours worked per person per year in various nations due to both increased productivity and the adoption of policies that limit working hours. The first task in this investigation is to determine how the decline in Argentina compares to that in other countries. The student finds that _____
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses data from the table to complete the student's conclusion?

options.name: A
options.content: the decline in number of hours worked was greater in Argentina than it was in Ireland, the United Kingdom, or Mexico.

options.name: B
options.content: while the number of hours worked rose in Argentina between1950 and 2017, it declined in Ireland, the United Kingdom, and Mexico.

options.name: C
options.content: though the percent decrease in hours worked in Argentina was greater than that in Ireland and Mexico, it was less than that in the United Kingdom.

options.name: D
options.content: though the percent decrease in hours worked in Argentina was less than that in Ireland and the United Kingdom, it was greater than that in Mexico.

questions.correct: though the percent decrease in hours worked in Argentina was less than that in Ireland and the United Kingdom, it was greater than that in Mexico.

questions.article: The Mammillaria cactus M. guerreronis occurs naturally only in the state of Guerrero in Mexico, and the smallness of its range makes it especially vulnerable to extinction. The traditional single-species approach to conservation emphasizes the need to focus on individual species most at risk, like M. guerreronis, but recently, conservationists have argued that an ecosystem-based approach that incorporates the many interactions between the climate, terrain, and various species of a given geographical area may lead to better outcomes for all the species in a given location. If this view is correct, the single-species approach to the conservation of M. guerreronis could thus ______
questions.question: Which choice most logically completes the text?

options.name: A
options.content: lead to a better understanding of how the distribution of Mammillaria species throughout Mexico has affected their survival.

options.name: B
options.content: allow conservationists to better consider how climatic changes affecting Guerrero may reduce the number of species competing with M. guerreronis.

options.name: C
options.content: erroneously shift the focus of conservation efforts away from M. guerreronis itself.

options.name: D
options.content: fail to consider the ways in which the survival of M. guerreronis may be influenced by changes in the populations of other species that inhabit Guerrero.

questions.correct: fail to consider the ways in which the survival of M. guerreronis may be influenced by changes in the populations of other species that inhabit Guerrero.

questions.article: It is widely known that New York City's Museum of Modern Art (MoMA) ______ a vast collection of oil paintings, including Paul Klee's In the Grass and Fernand Léger's Contrast of Forms.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: houses

options.name: B
options.content: to have housed

options.name: C
options.content: housing

options.name: D
options.content: to house

questions.correct: houses

questions.article: An accomplished birder might be able to spot thousands of different species over the course of a career, from Amadina erythrocephala to Arborophila rufogularis, but no birder has ever achieved the ultimate ______ an in-person glimpse of all 10,000-plus species of birds.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: goal catching

options.name: B
options.content: goal. Catching

options.name: C
options.content: goal: catching

options.name: D
options.content: goal; catching

questions.correct: goal: catching

questions.article: Today, the Michelin Guide is widely known as the arbiter of fine dining, with its coveted 3-star rating being awarded to top restaurants like Kitcho Arashiyama in ______ when brothers Andre and Edouard Michelin created the guide in 1900, it was little more than a marketing gimmick—a way to increase profits for their tire company by encouraging their customers to drive across France, visiting the guide's recommended hotels and restaurants along the way.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: Kyoto; however,

options.name: B
options.content: Kyoto,

options.name: C
options.content: Kyoto, however,

options.name: D
options.content: Kyoto

questions.correct: Kyoto; however,

questions.article: When attempting to determine a fault's seismic history, geophysicists like Dr. Estella Atekwana at the University of Delaware rely in part on data about the fault's physical dimensions and geological ______ the Imperial fault in Imperial County, California, the US Geological Survey compiles such data in several ways: by exchanging information with state geological surveys, by linking maps of the fault with sources that offer detailed descriptions of it, and by maintaining a database of quantitative data such as the fault's length (46 km).
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: features for

options.name: B
options.content: features, for

options.name: C
options.content: features. For

options.name: D
options.content: features and for

questions.correct: features. For

questions.article: In 1987, chemist Ahmed Zewail devised a novel technique in optical spectroscopy that allowed him to study ultrafast chemical reactions occurring within molecules. Years later, he ______ for this groundbreaking research with the Robert A. Welch Award and the Priestley Medal from the American Chemical Society and hence would become known as the father of femtochemistry.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: had been honored

options.name: B
options.content: would be honored

options.name: C
options.content: is honored

options.name: D
options.content: will be honored

questions.correct: would be honored

questions.article: For Canada, a member of the North Atlantic Treaty Organization (NATO) since 1949, NATO's principle of collective defense confers both benefits and ______ organization's many members, nations as disparate as the US and Slovenia, are all bound to defend Canada, the reverse is also true.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text so that it conforms to the conventions of Standard English?

options.name: A
options.content: obligations: while the

options.name: B
options.content: obligations; the

options.name: C
options.content: obligations, while the

options.name: D
options.content: obligations. The

questions.correct: obligations: while the

questions.article: If you could travel in a spaceship to Elara, one of Jupiter's many moons, you'd find a moon with a prograde orbit. This means that Elara orbits Jupiter in the same direction that Jupiter rotates on its axis. ________ at Pasiphae, another Jovian moon, you'd find an example of a retrograde orbit, with the moon revolving around Jupiter in the opposite direction.
questions.question: Which choice completes the text with the most logical transition?

options.name: A
options.content: For example,

options.name: B
options.content: Specifically,

options.name: C
options.content: In other words,

options.name: D
options.content: Elsewhere,

questions.correct: Elsewhere,

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Scientists have long sought to determine the origin of glass in Chile's Atacama Desert.
  • A 2017 study concluded that ancient grass fires had melted the area's sandy soil into glass.
  • In 2021, a different study revealed that the mineral signatures of glass samples were consistent with the mineral signatures of comet samples collected by NASA.
  • That study concluded that the glass had formed as a result of a cometary explosion close to the desert's surface.
questions.question: The student wants to describe how scientific understanding about the glass's origin has evolved. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Mineral signatures of glass samples are consistent with those of comet samples collected by NASA, according to new research.

options.name: B
options.content: A 2017 study concluded that ancient grass fires had caused the glass's formation, but new research suggests that the glass formed as a result of a cometary explosion close to the desert's surface.

options.name: C
options.content: Scientists have long sought to determine the origin of the glass, with one study concluding that it formed when ancient grass fires melted the area's sandy soil.

options.name: D
options.content: 选项缺失，不影响做题

questions.correct: A 2017 study concluded that ancient grass fires had caused the glass's formation, but new research suggests that the glass formed as a result of a cometary explosion close to the desert's surface.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • Maya Lin is a US artist known for her memorials and large-scale installation artworks.
  • She became famous in 1982 when she completed the Vietnam Veterans Memorial, which consists of two 246-foot granite walls.
  • She completed Water Line in 2006.
  • It is an installation composed of aluminum tubing that fills an entire gallery room.
  • She completed Seven Earth Mountain in 2015.
  • It is an installation composed of soil that fills an entire gallery room.
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses information from the given sentences to emphasize a difference between Water Line and Seven Earth Mountain?

options.name: A
options.content: Maya Lin's Water Line is composed of aluminum tubing; Seven Earth Mountain, by contrast, is composed of soil.

options.name: B
options.content: Maya Lin is known for her memorials and installation art, such as Water Line and Seven Earth Mountain.

options.name: C
options.content: After completing the Vietnam Veterans Memorial, Maya Lin completed Water Line, another large-scale work.

options.name: D
options.content: The sprawling size of Maya Lin's Vietnam Veterans Memorial is echoed in Water Line, a work made of aluminum tubing that fills an entire gallery room.

questions.correct: Maya Lin's Water Line is composed of aluminum tubing; Seven Earth Mountain, by contrast, is composed of soil.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains are a mountain range located in northwestern Mexico.
  • The range is one of the dozens of “sky islands” in the southwestern US and northwestern Mexico.
  • A sky island is an isolated mountain range whose environment differs drastically from that of the surrounding lowlands.
  • The US Forest Service (USFS) said, “The mountains are islands surrounded by deserts that are seas.”
  • The USFS said, “Each Sky Island is a unique ecosystem.”
questions.question: The student wants to explain what a sky island is. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: The Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains are an isolated mountain range located in northwestern Mexico whose environment differs drastically from that of the surrounding lowlands.

options.name: B
options.content: A sky island is an isolated mountain range, such as the Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains in northwestern Mexico, whose environment differs drastically from that of the surrounding lowlands.

options.name: C
options.content: The Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains, which are considered to be a sky island, are located in northwestern Mexico.

options.name: D
options.content: The USFS considers the Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains to be a “unique ecosystem.”

questions.correct: A sky island is an isolated mountain range, such as the Peloncillo-Pan Duro Mountains in northwestern Mexico, whose environment differs drastically from that of the surrounding lowlands.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The Paralympic Games are a series of international sporting events involving athletes with an impairment.
  • A gold medal indicates that an athlete finished in first place.
  • Rolf Heinzmann competed as a Paralympic alpine skier from 1980 to 2002.
  • He won fourteen medals, twelve of which were gold.
  • Daniel Dias competed as a Paralympic swimmer from 2008 to 2020.
  • He won thirty-eight medals, twenty-five of which were gold.
questions.question: Which choice most effectively uses information from the given sentences to emphasize the number of gold medals won by Daniel Dias?

options.name: A
options.content: In his career as a Paralympic swimmer, Daniel Dias won thirty-eight total medals — twenty-five of them were gold.

options.name: B
options.content: Both multiple gold medalists, Rolf Heinzmann and Daniel Dias debuted at the Paralympic Games in 1980 and 2008, respectively.

options.name: C
options.content: At the Paralympic Games, a gold medal indicates a first-place finish, and some accomplished athletes like Rolf Heinzmann have won many.

options.name: D
options.content: An accomplished Paralympian with thirty-eight total medals, Daniel Dias competed as a swimmer from 2008 to 2020.

questions.correct: In his career as a Paralympic swimmer, Daniel Dias won thirty-eight total medals — twenty-five of them were gold.

questions.article:
While researching a topic, a student has taken the following notes:

  • The human tongue contains taste receptors for a rich, savory flavor called umami.
  • Umami is triggered by the compounds in a variety of foods, including pork and tomato paste.
  • Participants in a study tasted a sample of macrokelp, a type of brown seaweed.
  • They rated its umami intensity as moderate.
  • The participants tasted a sample of ma-konbu, another type of brown seaweed.
  • They rated its umami intensity as high.
questions.question: The student wants to make a generalization about brown seaweed. Which choice most effectively uses relevant information from the notes to accomplish this goal?

options.name: A
options.content: Macrokelp is a type of brown seaweed, as is ma-konbu.

options.name: B
options.content: In a research study, participants tasted samples of macrokelp and ma-konbu, two types of brown seaweed.

options.name: C
options.content: Participants in a study rated the umami intensity of various seaweeds.

options.name: D
options.content: Some types of brown seaweed trigger umami flavor in human taste buds.

questions.correct: Some types of brown seaweed trigger umami flavor in human taste buds.
